# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/_cell_widths.py
@source-hash: 7db99ec9eb447478
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:41Z

## Purpose and Responsibility

Auto-generated Unicode cell width data table for terminal text rendering in the Rich library. Contains character width classifications for proper text alignment and display width calculations.

## Key Data Structure

**CELL_WIDTHS** (L3-454): List of tuples defining Unicode character width properties
- Format: `(start_codepoint, end_codepoint, display_width)`
- `display_width` values:
  - `0`: Zero-width characters (combining marks, control chars)
  - `2`: Full-width characters (CJK ideographs, emojis)  
  - `-1`: Negative width characters (control sequences)

## Character Classification Ranges

**Control/Zero-width ranges** (L4-6, L8-129, etc.):
- Null characters, combining marks, diacritics
- Arabic/Hebrew marks, Indic vowel signs
- Format controls and invisible separators

**Full-width CJK blocks** (L130, L204-219, L253, L449-450):
- Hangul syllables (44032-55203)
- CJK ideographs (12880-19903, 19968-42124, 131072-262141)
- Japanese hiragana/katakana ranges

**Emoji and symbol ranges** (L167-198, L401-448):
- Miscellaneous symbols (9725-9726, 9748-9749)
- Emoticons and pictographs (127744-128764)
- Extended emoji blocks (129292-129784)

## Dependencies

- Generated by `make_terminal_widths.py` (external script)
- Part of Rich library's text measurement system
- Unicode standard compliance for terminal width calculation

## Architectural Notes

- Static lookup table approach for O(log n) width determination
- Sorted by codepoint ranges for binary search compatibility
- Covers Unicode blocks through latest standards
- Critical for accurate terminal text layout and cursor positioning
